Posts.Content: Well exactly 1 year ago today I was told the news no one wants to hear.... ‘you have cancer’. Where has the time gone...? From an endless round of appointments/scans/surgery then radiotherapy the months flew by.  I count myself lucky that I got off quite lightly & didn’t need chemo.  I’d just like to wish all of you well in your ongoing treatment & for those, like me who’s treatment has finished I hope you’re not left with too many after affects.  I have an appt next week at the OAFU breast clinic then 2 weeks later my first mammogram since treatment so I’m dreading that one! Hopefully I won’t have to wait too long for the result.  Best wishes to you all Love Nikki x
Posts.Title: 1 year

Posts.Content: Hi Jax 0609, hope all goes well for you on Monday with the mammogram... I think the part I’m dreading most is having my ‘poorly boob’ squished lol, let’s hope results are quick for both of us. How are you getting on with Anastrazole? I bailed out after a couple of months as the side effects were dreadful. All the best N x
Posts.Title: 1 year
